;香港将于2025年举办大型展览业峰会，标志着这是继 Covid-19 大流行后宣布重返该市的最新大型活动。

;

;UFI 全球大会的组织者全球展览业协会周二表示，该活动将在该协会在全球拥有 820 个会员组织和 50,000 名员工，该协会称，这是世界上最大的行业盛会。

;

;去年的活动在阿曼首都马斯喀特举行，约有 400 人和 60 名演讲者参加。

;

;该会议于 2000 年在香港举行。最近的主办城市包括： 2021 年荷兰鹿特丹；2021 年荷兰鹿特丹；2021 年荷兰鹿特丹； 2019年泰国曼谷和2018年俄罗斯圣彼得堡。由于疫情，该活动于2020年改为在线举办。

;

;上海是最后一个举办该活动的中国城市，该活动于2016年举办。

;

;它将于今年 11 月在美国拉斯维加斯举行，并于 2024 年在德国科隆举行。

;

;“UFI 全球大会将通过峰会活动主席 Michael Duck 表示：“2025 年全球领先的展览市场……香港将把全球 UFI 社区带到大中华区。”

;

;尽管香港的旅行有所缓解，但亚洲科技峰会 RISE 仍推迟至 2024 年规则

;

;亚洲国际博览馆行政总裁陈芳英表示：“亚洲国际博览馆位于中国快速发展的大湾区的中心地带，完美展示了大湾区的协同效应和丰富潜力。湾区是中国政府的计划，旨在将香港、澳门、广州、深圳、珠海、佛山、中山、东莞、惠州、江门和肇庆等城市连接成一个综合经济体和商业中心。

;

;在此宣布之前，RISE 科技会议的组织者决定在多次推迟后，于 2025 年将该活动带回香港。

;

;香港必须恢复竞争力，帮助贫困老人：李约翰

;

;香港自 2015 年推出以来一直主办年度科技峰会，但该活动自 2020 年以来已暂停。组织者试图于 2022 年在马来西亚首都吉隆坡举办，但随着病毒在东南亚蔓延，该计划最终被取消。

;

;为吸引大型活动回流香港，政府于去年10月宣布推出14亿港元的“经常展览奖励计划”今年 7 月 1 日至 2026 年 6 月 30 日期间举办的活动将获得年度奖励。根据该计划，定期展览的组织者可以获得相当于其场地租金 100% 的奖励。

; Tue, 11 Jul 2023 21:50:02 +0800 Tilting towards Washington, has India’s time over China come?https://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3227335/tilting-towards-washington-has-indias-time-over-china-come?utm_source=rss_feed

;中国驻印度高级特使一职自10月以来一直空缺，前任大使孙卫东在新德里任职三年后返回北京，担任外交部副部长。

;

;这是四十年来最长的一次差距，反映出中国与中国本已紧张的关系有可能进一步恶化。

;

;由于这两个亚洲大国没有表现出结束危险的军事对峙的意愿，这场对峙始于 2020 年 6 月拉达克东部发生的致命边境冲突，因此新德里果断地倾向于华盛顿。

;

;印度加强了与美国的军事关系，以制衡中国，在加入“四方”方面迈出了重要一步。“四方”是一个由美国领导、与日本和澳大利亚组成的四方组织，北京方面将其斥为“四方”组织。 “印度-太平洋北约”。

;

;这种提升在上个月纳伦德拉·莫迪总理历史性访问白宫期间得到体现，华盛顿消除了广泛的国防、高科技和出口贸易壁垒，寻求将两国关系提升为平等的全球战略伙伴关系。

;

;然后上周，美国总统乔·拜登负责印太地区的高级官员库尔特·坎贝尔 (Kurt Campbell) 将印度描述为“最受欢迎的国家之一” ”并称赞美印关系是“地球上最重要的双边关系”。

;

;几十年来，美国总统和高级官员一直将华盛顿与北京的关系称为最重要的关系以及随之而来的世界双边关系。

;

;坎贝尔的言论标志着美国外交政策优先事项的里程碑式转变，美国外交政策优先事项已从 1970 年代初以来的接触急剧转变为遏制中国崛起的冷战式遏制战略

;

;三周前，拜登在白宫与莫迪一起讲话，他亲眼目睹了过去五年接触战略的兴衰，他明确表示，他的外交政策是价值观驱动的。

;

;“我认为美中关系不像美印关系那样，根本原因之一是我们彼此之间存在压倒性的尊重，因为我们都是民主国家， ”美国领导人说道。

;

;但这并不意味着华盛顿和新德里在许多关键问题上意见一致，例如印度侵犯人权、拒绝谴责俄罗斯对乌克兰的侵略以及华盛顿的安全与德里的主要竞争对手伊斯兰堡的关系。

;

;除了中国因素之外，德里转向华盛顿的战略重心最重要的似乎是美国保证不会就与俄罗斯的关系对印度说教。

;

; p>;

;“我们正在投资一种关系，我们不会通过一个问题来判断，即使这个问题非常重要，而是当我们努力工作时，我们将在时间充裕的情况下进行判断美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文去年 6 月表示：“在我们两国面临的重大战略问题上达成共识。”

;

;“在其中一个问题上，即如何应对中国构成的挑战，今天更加趋同，这对美国的外交政策很重要。”

;

;考虑到这一点，华盛顿已承诺无论如何都会在与北京的边界争端中支持德里，这无疑会限制中国寻求解决方案的选择摆脱紧张边境局势的出路。

;

;在莫迪进行国事访问时，拜登为自己称习近平为独裁者进行了辩护

;

;莫迪最近对中国国家主席习近平标志性的“一带一路”倡议的冷落本月初举行的上海合作组织虚拟峰会增加了双边关系前景的不确定性，特别是备受猜测的习近平计划出席 9 月在印度首都举行的 G20 峰会。

;

;中国领导人的缺席驻德里大使使双方处理分歧变得更加困难。

;

;随着德里将在华盛顿的对外关系等级中取代北京，以及美国为帮助印度崛起提供支持 — — 这种支持可能是与华盛顿多年来向北京提供的信息相比——正如莫迪和其他分析人士一再宣称的那样，印度的时代可能终于到来了。

;

;德里可能不想成为“任何形式的‘遏制’的一部分”印度前外长夏姆·萨兰表示，“中国的”，但不可否认的是，中印之间的竞争正在加剧。

;

;两国都渴望成为地区乃至全球超级大国，德里已经做好了准备在未来的许多年和几十年里成为北京最重要的地缘政治竞争对手。中印之间是否正在形成修昔底德陷阱？

;中国科学家表示他们已经开发出一种新的固态电池技术来匹配切割-成本仅为 4%。

;

;大多数电动汽车电池都是磷酸铁锂或三元锂电池，每种电池在成本稳定性和能量密度方面都有自己的优点。然而，两者都含有液体电解质。

;

;液体的能量存储密度比固体低。尽管液体电池技术取得了进步，但其笨重、重量和潜在的火灾风险阻碍了其在轻型电动汽车中的使用。

;

;但安徽省中国科学技术大学 (USTC) 的研究人员已经能够开发全固态电池（使用固体电解质进行传导），其成本也仅为其一小部分，为该技术的商业应用带来了巨大的希望。

;

;固态电池比传统电池具有许多优势与传统电池相比，例如双倍的能量密度、更快的充电速度和不受限制的充电温度。

;

;由于它们不易燃、无腐蚀且防漏，这些下一代电池也代表了一种更安全的电池电动汽车和储能行业的选择。

;

;然而，高生产成本阻碍了大规模应用。

;

;固体电解质需要昂贵的金属，如镧和钴，并且制造过程需要高精度和专用生产线。

;

;中国在提高金属产量以促进清洁能源发展方面排名第三

;

;为了应对这一挑战，中国科学技术大学马成教授领导的团队开发了一种新型固体电解质，称为氯氧化锆锂。根据上个月发表在同行评审期刊《自然通讯》上的研究结果，其性能与先进的硫化物和氯化物固体电解质相当，但成本仅为其 4%。

;

;商业上可行的固态锂电池电解液必须具有高离子电导率、良好的“变形性”或减震能力，并且成本低于每公斤50美元。

;

;现有的电解液都无法满足所有这些标准。陶瓷电解质普遍缺乏变形能力，而硫化物和氯化物价格昂贵，每公斤成本超过200美元。

;

;然而，马云及其团队开发的氯氧化锆锂电解质实现了更高的室温离子电导率。超过实际应用所需标准的两倍。同时，其优异的变形能力使材料能够在高压下保持形状，满足应用要求。

;

;“团队提供了两种合成路线，一种原料成本仅为11.6美元/公斤，另一种原料成本仅为11.6美元/公斤，每公斤不到 7 美元。在应用测试中，使用氯氧化锆锂的电池充电仅需12分钟，并在室温下保持稳定循环超过2000次。”中国科大在一份声明中表示。

;

;学术界和工业生产者都在加快速度。加强他们对下一代技术的追求。然而，鉴于全固态电池的材料和制造成本较高，中国的电动汽车公司迄今为止都选择了半固态电池。

;

;使用硫化物作为固态电解质的日本汽车巨头丰田也据《金融时报》7 月 4 日报道，丰田计划将固态电池技术商业化。

;

;丰田碳中和先进工程开发中心总裁 Keiji Kaita 表示，他们的目标是将固态电池的尺寸、重量和成本减半报告称，包括液体和固体电池。

;

;他表示，丰田已经开发出提高电池耐用性的方法，并相信它可以制造续航里程为 1,200 公里（745 英里）和充电功能的固态电池。时间仅需10分钟甚至更短。

;

;丰田的推动无疑将加剧电动汽车电池领域与中国的竞争，中国去年的锂离子电池出口量占全球出货量的近70%。

;

;不过，丰田的产品预计至少要到2025年才会上市，量产可能要到2027年之后。

;

;“丰田拥有全球最大的新能源汽车市场，在相关科技领域处于领先地位。中国电动汽车协会智库副理事长董扬一月份对上海观察者网表示，中国将在固态电池产业化方面取得重大进展。

;周二，TikTok 和 Meta 的澳大利亚代表在堪培拉面临立法者的质询。平台努力打击外国干涉，其场景让人想起 TikTok 首席执行官在美国面临的国会堆积如山的攻击。<​​/p>;

;这项调查旨在研究澳大利亚民主受到损害的方式外国通过社交媒体进行干预，与主持听证会的著名对华鹰派参议员詹姆斯·帕特森 (James Paterson) 发生了激烈的冲突。

;

;帕特森试图让听证会专门针对中国，因为他向 TikTok 代表询问了中国的做法。涉嫌新疆侵犯人权，并提到 Covid-19 起源于武汉的阴谋论 - 询问与该理论相关的内容是否被平台归类为错误信息。

;

;澳大利亚禁止在政府设备上使用 TikTok

;

;TikTok 澳大利亚公共政策总监埃拉·伍兹-乔伊斯 (Ella Woods-Joyce) 表示，该公司没有“基于任何政治敏感性审查或推广内容”，但帕特森问她为什么 2020 年 8 月 TikTok 内容中只有“5.6%”涉及新疆引用澳大利亚战略政策研究所智库的研究来批评共产党。

;

;“所以这只是一个巧合，TikTok 上关于新疆的内容 95% 都是正面的，而像 Human 这样的机构人权观察、国际特赦组织、联合国和世界各地许多政府表示，是否存在反人类罪、种族灭绝罪或其他严重侵犯人权行为？这对你来说听起来自然吗？”他说。

;

;“让我问你的看法，你认为新疆是否存在侵犯人权的情况？”

;

;类似于 TikTok 首席执行官寿子周 (Shou Zi Chew) 在3月份，帕特森还询问伍兹-乔伊斯，TikTok的母公司字节跳动是否是一家中国公司，是否有“内部共产党委员会”。

;

;“你不愿承认有关母公司的基本事实，对于你愿意诚实回答这些问题来说，你最终雇用的人并不是一个有希望的开始……因为字节跳动有一个[共产党]委员会是一个明确的事实，”他说。

;

;北京总部位于北京的字节跳动一再坚称其不属于中国政府所有，其约 60% 的股份由非中国投资者持有，其中包括西方社交媒体平台 LinkedIn 和 Twitter。

;

;帕特森应用了对 TikTok 的美国数据安全专家威尔·法雷尔 (Will Farrell) 和澳大利亚总经理李·亨特 (Lee Hunter) 提出同样好斗的质询，要么打断他们，要么批评他们回避。

;

;Meta 的代表——Facebook、Instagram、WhatsApp 的所有者和 Threads – 以及 LinkedIn 在周二的听证会上也接受了有关中国的询问。特别是，他们被问及将所谓的实验室泄漏理论的内容“错误地标记”为错误信息。

;

;“现在我应该强调，我们今天仍然不知道它是否是天然来源的，或者是否来自武汉神经病学研究所，”帕特森说。 “无论哪种方式，这似乎都是一个应该进行辩论的问题，直到我们确实就这两种方式得出结论性答案为止，但它在您的平台上受到限制。您从中有何反思或吸取教训吗？”

;

;Meta 的澳大利亚和新西兰政策总监 Mia Garlick 表示，该公司在“特殊情况”期间采纳了收到的最佳建议。

;

; p>;

;澳大利亚人看到了与中国紧密联系的好处，但希望禁止中国应用程序：民意调查

;

;国际社会对 Covid-19 的起源进行了激烈的争论，其中一些人在美国和等国家澳大利亚坚称该病毒起源于武汉的一个实验室，该实验室于 2019 年报告了第一例人类病例。

;

;中国表示这一理论不可信，美国情报机构 6 月表示他们没有发现直接证据支持这一点——尽管他们不能排除该病毒来自实验室的可能性。

;

;听证会之前就有人预计这将成为立法者拷问的机会来自腾讯旗下中国超级应用程序微信的代表。除了在国内普及之外，该应用程序在全球华人侨民中也很受欢迎。

;

;微信在澳大利亚没有常驻代表，因此堪培拉立法者无法强制高管出席听证会。腾讯周一表示，尽管缺席，但该公司认真对待所有市场的法律合规性，并期待与澳大利亚利益相关者进行接触。

;

;帕特森早些时候在给该公司的一封信中警告称，其缺席将导致他的委员会“不可避免地就其与澳大利亚法律合作的意愿得出结论”。

;

;

;

;在委员会收到的 40 份意见书中，一些人呼吁彻底禁止与中国相关的微信和 TikTok。

;

;两位澳大利亚专家在听证会前的周末在微信上发表了一份新的意见书，称禁止这些应用程序将损害澳大利亚的民主。

;

;在最后一组中在 4 月份的听证会上，调查听取了目击者的证词，他们称中国政府使用微信骚扰他们及其家人。

;

;这组证词引起了激烈的争论，禁令的支持者将微信描述为“ [共产党]的叙事机器”，而另一些人则认为禁令是虚伪的，并为西方拥有的平台提供了免费通行证，尽管其中一些平台由与权利记录有问题的国家有联系的实体部分拥有。

;

;微信跳过澳大利亚社交媒体关于“政治干预”的听证会

;

;澳大利亚微信研究领域的领军人物、悉尼科技大学的孙万宁和皇家墨尔本理工大学的于海清在最新提交的材料中指出，禁止微信会无意中伤害澳大利亚人

;

;他们指出，约有 120 万具有中国大陆血统的澳大利亚人使用微信。他们表示，禁令“可能会损害社会凝聚力，并可能被视为出于种族和政治动机”。

;

;他们还指出，微信及其中文版微信是独立的系统，而微信由一家总部位于新加坡的实体运营。

;

;Taiwan will expand the scope of its air-raid drills – which test the public's response to potential warplane and missile attacks by the People's Liberation Army – when the annual exercise is held later this month.

;

;In addition to testing civilian preparedness, this year's drills will also assess how well Taiwan's 22 local governments carry out evacuations of residents and the procedures once they are at their nearest air-raid shelters, the defence ministry said on Tuesday.

;

;Each local government will have to designate a neighbourhood – which could be a village, town, city or municipal district – for the evacuation exercise, according to Chu Sen-tsuen, personnel director at the defence ministry's All-Out Defence Mobilisation Agency.

;

;“The air-raid drills will be held in turn in the northern part of Taiwan on July 24, the southern part on July 25, the eastern and outlying islands on July 26, and the central area on July 27,” Chu said.

;

;Drills testing the preparedness of civilians will be held from 1.30pm to 2pm, and the evacuation exercise will run from 2pm to 2.30pm.

;

;Everyone will be required to stay indoors and all traffic must stop when the air-raid sirens are activated. All individuals, government units, schools, organisations, companies and factories will be required to cooperate with relevant agencies during the evacuation drills.

;

;“Anyone who fails to comply with the requirements will be subject to a fine of between NT$30,000 and NT$150,000 [US$956 and US$4,780] in accordance with the civil defence law,” Chu said.

;

;At the same news conference, Lin Kuo-hua, deputy director of the National Policy Agency's civil defence control centre, said there were 5,475 air-raid shelters across Taiwan. They could accommodate 54.4 million people – more than double the island's 23.5 million population, Lin said.

;

;The air-raid drills will again coincide with the five-day annual Han Kuang military exercises that begin on July 24, testing the combat readiness of the island's forces for an all-out attack by the PLA, the defence ministry said.

;

;They will assess how well Taiwan's military can intercept and strike back at PLA forces coming from sea, air and land, and will also put the civil defence force to the test in working with the military on homeland defence and disaster relief.

;

;Xi Jinping praises military branch keeping up the pressure on Taiwan

;

;The annual drills come amid heightened tensions across the Taiwan Strait.台湾持续受到北京的威胁，北京将台湾视为其领土的一部分，并誓言要将其置于其控制之下 — — 如有必要，将使用武力。 Most countries, including the United States, do not recognise Taiwan as an independent state but oppose any unilateral change in the cross-strait status quo by force.

;

;Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taipei last August when she was US House speaker inflamed tensions with Beijing, which saw the trip as a serious violation of its sovereignty.作为报复，解放军在该岛周围进行了大规模的实弹演习。 More war games were held in April after Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen met Pelosi's successor, Kevin McCarthy, in the US.

;

;The PLA has since then intensified its military activities around Taiwan, including sending warplanes over the median line that separates the island and mainland China in the Taiwan Strait. PLA aircraft and warships have also been seen close to eastern Taiwan, where defence capabilities are reportedly not as strong.

;

;Taiwan's defence ministry said 34 PLA warplanes were spotted near the island on Tuesday, and 29 of them crossed the median line to enter its air defence identification zone in both the southwest and southeast.据称，四艘解放军舰艇也参与了此次行动。 Taiwan's military sent warplanes and ships to shadow the PLA and deployed its missile systems.

;

;Also on Tuesday, the island's military denied media reports that Taiwan was developing biological weapons under US instruction, saying it would not do so because it would breach the international convention.

;

;The military also refuted a claim by a New Taipei City councillor that the bulletproof vests worn by Taiwanese troops could be penetrated by regular machine gun and rifle cartridges used by the PLA.

;

;Lin Ping-yu, of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party, made the claim last week, saying tests conducted in the US had found the vests were not effective.

;

;“I can't … say for sure that our [vests] are 100 per cent bulletproof in the absence of using [PLA] firearms for testing,” said Yu Yu-tang, administration director of the Armaments Bureau.

;

;But he said testing had shown the vests could resist penetration by a regular 7.62mm-calibre cartridge, which was more powerful than the 5.8mm-calibre cartridge commonly used by the PLA.

;Chinese University has said a blood test created by its researchers in Hong Kong has been proven to be effective in detecting early nasopharyngeal cancer risk in asymptomatic patients, with those showing persistently positive test results 17 times more likely to get the disease later in life.

;

;The university's research team on Tuesday also said its findings revealed that some of the “false positives” - those who showed positive results in an initial screening but did not have cancer - were subsequently diagnosed with it years later.

;

;Professor Dennis Lo Yuk-Ming, director of the Li Ka Shing Institute of Health Sciences at the university, said there were two possibilities behind this result.

;

;“It was possible that the false positive people were carrying the cancer virus, which gradually developed into cancer years later, or they were already at an extremely early stage of cancer which was not yet detectable by endoscopic examination or MRI,” he said.

;

;“If those people did not have cancer at that stage, but the virus was active in their bodies.我们能做点什么，比如开药来抑制病毒活动吗？ That's one of the questions we need to work on.”

;

;The plasma screening test can detect the Epstein-Barr virus in the blood, which is closely associated with nasopharyngeal cancer, one of the most common cancers in the city, with about 700 new cases recorded every year.

;

;The risk of developing the disease is three times higher for men, with the peak incidence age being about 50 to 60.

;

;Blood test could save patients with hard-to-spot head and neck cancer

;

;Only 20 per cent of cases are detected early, when the five-year survival rate is about 90 per cent. Most are discovered at a later stage, when the chances of survival for the same time period drop below 70 per cent.

;

;Antibody screening for the disease only has a positive predictive value of five per cent, while the university's blood test has an accuracy rate of about 19 per cent.

;

;As part of the study, the research team tested more than 20,000 asymptomatic middle-aged men from 2013 to 2016.

;

;Among them, 309 received persistently positive results in the initial and follow-up tests, with 34 later diagnosed in endoscopic and MRI exams, out of which 70 per cent were in the early cancer stage.

;

;Between 2017 and 2021, the team launched a second round of screening for 17,000 of the initial participants, among which 677 and 237 had transient and persistent positive results in the first stage, respectively, but were not diagnosed with cancer in endoscopic and MRI exams.

;

;Hong Kong study reveals new way of treating lung cancer with gene-edited cells

;

;Twenty-four participants were diagnosed with cancer, out of which three displayed transient positive results in the first round, and four showed persistent positive results.

;

;Professor Allen Chan Kwan-chee, from the university's Chemical Pathology department, said the findings suggested a correlation between positive results and the risk of developing nasopharyngeal cancer later in life.

;

;He said that participants with transient positive results were 4.4 times more likely to develop the disease, while those with persistent positive results were 17 times more likely to get the cancer.

;

;“The findings tell us that even if you get a positive result, but are not diagnosed with cancer immediately, you should not ignore the risk,” he said.

;

;“We recommend them to conduct a cancer screening every one or two years, to facilitate early detection and increase the survival rate.”

;

;Researchers would continue to monitor the 20,000 cases, he added.

;

;Discussions were under way with the Hospital Authority to make the first generation of the plasma screening technology, which is a real-time polymerase chain reaction test, available at public hospitals, Chan revealed.

;

;But he said that the latest version of the screening was more costly and would only be available at private institutions for HK$2,000 (US$255).

;

;As plasma-DNA based tests are becoming increasingly common in detecting various kinds of cancer, Professor Lo said he believed a similar phenomenon involving false positives could be affecting other cancers as well, adding that more studies were needed.

;

;The findings have been published in NEJM Evidence, a publication under the New England Journal of Medicine Group.

;A Hong Kong merchant has been jailed for four months after he assaulted two policemen in a drunken attack early this year that ended with one of the officers shooting him three times.

;

;Oliver Dairo Arimas, 43, pleaded guilty at Eastern Court on Tuesday to two counts of assaulting a police officer after a barbecue on the outlying island of Peng Chau on January 24, the third day of Lunar New Year.

;

;A duty lawyer representing Arimas said the defendant was under the influence of alcohol when he attacked the officers.

;

;Principal Magistrate Ivy Chui Yee-mei said the only mitigating factor was the defendant's timely guilty plea. She accepted the case was not the most serious of its kind as he did not use a weapon.

;

;Arimas' co-defendant, 33-year-old driver Cione Chris Alvarez Sacdalan, was released on a bind-over order on charges of assaulting and wilfully obstructing a police officer on the same day.

;

;Chui warned him against committing further offences against a police officer or that involved violence for the next three years, failing which he would be fined HK$2,000 (US$255) and could face heavier penalties.

;

;Sacdalan was also required to pay HK$1,000 towards the costs of the proceedings

;

;The two defendants had a barbecue with six others on the rooftop of a three-storey building on Peng Chau's Wing On Street on January 24, Eastern Court heard on Tuesday. But neighbours complained to police twice about loud music coming from a flat below the rooftop.

;

;Man shot by Hong Kong police in January receives extra charge of assaulting officer

;

;The two policemen, identified in court as Senior Constable Cheng Kuen-chung and Constable Tam Hung-kwan, went to investigate soon before 11pm.

;

;Sacdalan first answered the door before Arimas pulled the door wide open and confronted the two officers.

;

;The merchant reportedly reeked of alcohol when he pulled Cheng's shirt collar and said: “I know you, I recognise you.”

;

;Arimas then muttered something unintelligible “in a loud and angry manner” before attempting to drag Cheng into the flat, but the officer held his ground.

;

;Tam tried to stop Arimas but was blocked by Sacdalan, who shoved him with his left elbow.

;

;Hong Kong policeman attacked before shooting suspect 3 times, force says

;

;Arimas then grabbed Cheng by the neck, pushed him down a staircase and chased him to a nearby restaurant. He also threatened to attack Tam by raising a clenched fist.

;

;Just as Cheng was about to use pepper spray on Arimas, the latter charged towards him and knocked the weapon out of his hand.

;

;“[Cheng] had nowhere to retreat,” the prosecution filing said. “To prevent further attack by [Arimas], [Cheng] had no other alternative but to shoot [Arimas].”

;

;The senior constable fired a shot and when Arimas came at him again, he fired two more rounds, the court heard.

;

;Arimas was shot in the abdomen and arm and at one point was in critical condition. He spent more than a month in hospital.

;

;Gang of 6 in Hong Kong jailed up to 40 months for attack on policeman

;

;The filing highlighted the difference in physique between Arimas and Cheng, as well as the former's “threatening” behaviour, to justify the officer's use of force.

;

;Cheng suffered multiple abrasions on his neck and pain in his lower back, while his junior colleague had no visible injuries.

;

;The filing made no reference to Arimas' injuries apart from saying he was subdued and sent to hospital.

;

;Magistrate Chui on Tuesday jailed Arimas for three months for his attack on Cheng, and four weeks for his offence against Tam. She ordered the sentences to be served separately.

;

;Under the Offences against the Person Ordinance, anyone convicted of assaulting, resisting or wilfully obstructing a police officer in the due execution of their duties can receive up to two years in jail.
